page.title: 08AN INTERVIEW WITH P.C.READER
page.content: Louise Green and Marsha Logan interviewed our local community policeman, P.C. Eddie Reader. "I enjoy my job, more than likely because I like meeting and helping people. On average I arrest one or two people a week for crime. On Saturdays I believe that about half a dozen children are arrested. 3,000 people a year join the police force. Not many detectives carry guns. Only diplomatic bodyguards and guards for the Queen and Prime Minister carry guns. It is a male orientated job but now it is changing. Each policeman has his own number. I think uniforms will change with fashion but not much.They will still be the same colour, blue or black. I would like my hours reduced, but there aren't enough hours in the day for the work I have to do."
